reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Thrilling, heart-rending, and delightfully funny
reviews.reviewText: Before I start talking about the book itself, I do want to point out for future readers that only about 44% of the book is part of the eight volume story. About 35% roughly is a collection of bonus short stories that all seem to take place after. The remaining miscellaneous % is the ever growing appendix. I feel that MXTX books are often misleading because 20% or more is usually the appendix and the last volume of each series seems to be 50% or less actual mainline story.The content making up the mainline story really does wrap it up well but also didn't feel like a full book. It was definitely necessary to finish the story, but it also felt like it could have just been tacked onto the previous volume and it would have been fine. It just didn't have enough substance to warrant a whole new volume. That being said, there are moments that just emotionally punch you. There's one particular moment that made me cry so much I had to put the book down and walk away for a while. Very moving...I was actually surprised by the selection of bonus chapters at the end. With MXTX previous series she usually has at least one or two adult rated contents chapters at the end. Usually those chapters leave me feeling mixed feelings because they don't tend to be very loving, often a little violent and or painful... So I've been feeling low level anxiety waiting to see what bonus content she was going to put in this one. I was surprised that she did not include anything graphic. She sort of does this hand waving thing where it's acknowledged that our beloved main characters have relations but she just doesn't go into the details. Personally, I think this was a bit of a relief for me. I don't know if she could write lovemaking scene that I felt would match the gentle loving devotion that Crimson Rain would demonstrate. Instead, we get multiple chapters of the two of them just enjoying life and adventures together. I think it was just fine. One of the bonus chapters, the one about the statues, had me laughing so hard that I had to take breaks for my eyes to clear up enough to read, I just couldn't stop crying from laughter! I think the bonus chapters in this volume for this series were well worth the time.I confess that I am very sad that this is the last volume. I deeply wish there was more to their story, it would be nice to have another long adventure for them. One that didn't have to focus so much from the struggle for them to be a couple. But maybe that would just dilute the beauty of their story if we didn't have an ending. I guess there's a sadness left behind in my heart because this is the end. This banquet is over.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Special Edition is so worth it!
reviews.reviewText: I was excited and knew it would come with extras, but I vastly underestimated just how wonderful everything would be. Post card versions of each book cover, an absolutely ADORABLE paper standee, stickers, a notebook, and two gorgeous mini posters. I cannot stress enough what amazing quality everything is and how impressed I am with the content for the cost I paid.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful book, great extras!
reviews.reviewText: Heaven Official's Blessing is an amazing story and this last book pulls everything together into an amazing finale. The extras included in this addition are a must for any danmei collector, they packed a lot into that shrink-wrap!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars i love it sm
reviews.reviewText: super good came in perfect condition it comes with stickers and postcards posters a bookmark and a paper standee thing i love it all including the mini notebook it came with definitely recommend buying

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: All the art looked fantastic but what I love most was how the story ended on such a loving note.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The special edition add-ons are awesome! I highly recommend it. The artwork is so pretty and it came with everything advertised. I'm very excited to read this volume!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great book. Great ending to this book series .Love the author I have become a big fan . I been buying and reading all her book series never disappointed, allways enchanted....

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent end to their story
reviews.reviewText: I've been following the official translation since Seven Seas put it out, reaching each book in one day, two maybe, right after they came out. This was a wonderful end to the story, and I love that they include the bonus stories, as they add a lot to the character's journeys, even after the main plot is done. So happy with this series!

Me encantó, todo llego en perfectas condiciones, todo tiene muy buena calidad y me encantan, no entendí bien como armar el stand de papel pero creo que lo logré, el cuadernillo y los stickers me gustaron pero no creo poder usarlos, las postales tienen diseños hermosos, recomiendo a cualquiera comprar el producto
Simply adore this series. Both the books and the anime are simply beautiful. And the extras that came with this book, are works of art. Highly recommend
Finally my wish of having all volume 8 of my beloved book heaven official blessing is complete .I couldn't be any more happy .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: So so ending, I expected more it felt like a rush and a quick ending with some questions not being answered. However the series is one of my favorites and I will keep them well on my bookshelf. I hope for hardcover versions in the future.
